[[Order of the Red Star]] (2) }} '''Vasily Dmitrievich Myachin''' ({{Lang-ru|Василий Дмитриевич Мячин}}; 17 December 1918{{Endash}}14 March 1980) was a [[Soviet Army]] [[colonel]] and a [[Hero of the Soviet Union]]. Myachin was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union for his leadership of a battalion during the [[Berlin Offensive]]. Postwar, Myachin continued to serve in the army, retiring in 1978, after which he worked as an air traffic controller.{{Ruheroes|id=4863}} == Early life == Myachin was born on 19 December 1918 in the village of [[Soldatskoye]] (now in [[Terbunsky District]], [[Lipetsk Oblast]]) to a peasant family. He graduated from seventh grade and worked on the kolkhoz as a bookkeeper.{{Cite web|url=http://lounb.ru/war/personalii/myachin-vasilij-dmitrievich|title=Мячин Василий Дмитриевич|last=|first=|date=|website=Память Вечного огня [Eternal Flame of Memory]|publisher=Lipetsk Regional Universal Scientific Library|language=Russian|trans-title=Myachin Vasily Dmitrievich|access-date=8 November 2016}} In 1938, Myachin was drafted into the [[Red Army]].{{Cite book|url=http://www.az-libr.ru/index.htm?Persons&CZR/4472e399/index|title=Герои Советского Союза: Краткий биографический словарь|last=|first=|publisher=Voenizdat|year=1988|isbn=5203005362|editor-last=Shkadov|editor-first=Ivan|volume=2 Lyubov-Yashchuk|location=Moscow|language=Russian|trans-title=Heroes of the Soviet Union: A Brief Biographical Dictionary|quote=|via=}} == World War II == Myachin fought in the [[Winter War]] and was discharged in 1940. For his actions Myachin received the [[Medal "For Courage" (Russia)|Medal "For Courage"]]. He was drafted again in 1941 and fought in combat from August 1941. He became a [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]] member in 1943. In 1944, he graduated from courses for junior lieutenants. On 27 July, he was awarded the [[Order of the Patriotic War]] 1st class for his actions on 24 and 26 June. At this time, he was a captain in the [[37th Guards Rifle Division]]'s 114th Guards Rifle Regiment.Order No. 368 of the 65th Army, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie31381511/ pamyat-naroda.ru] On 8 November, Myachin was awarded the [[Order of Alexander Nevsky]] for his actions between 7 and 9 October.Order No. 457 of the 65th Army, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie36142251/ pamyat-naroda.ru] Myachin became a major and battalion commander in the regiment by January 1945. On 10 February, he was awarded the [[Order of Suvorov]], 3rd class, for his actions in 15 January.Order No. 103 of the 2nd Belorussian Front, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie27328237/ pamyat-naroda.ru] Myachin fought in the [[Berlin Offensive]] in April and May 1945. On 19 April, he led his battalion across the [[Oder]] south of [[Stettin]] with little loss, capturing a bridgehead. According to his superiors, Myachin's battalion repulsed eighteen counterattacks by numerically superior German troops while expanding the bridgehead. On 20 and 21 April, the battalion was reported to have killed 400 German soldiers, destroyed eighteen emplacements, and knocked out four self-propelled guns and a tank. During fighting on 22 to 23 April, near [[Kołbaskowo]], Myachin was reported by his superiors to have personally led his battalion seven times in the attack against the German strongpoint. On 29 June 1945, he was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union and the [[Order of Lenin]] for his actions.Hero of the Soviet Union citation, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie150022668/ pamyat-naroda.ru] == Postwar == Myachin continued to serve in the Soviet Army postwar, retiring in 1978. He worked as an air traffic controller at the [[Rostov-on-Don Airport]]. He died on 14 March 1980 and was buried at the city's Severnoye Cemetery. == References == {{Heroes of the Soviet Union 37th GRD}} [[Category:1918 births]] [[Category:1980 deaths]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Lenin]] [[Category:Soviet Army officers]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel of World War II]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Suvorov, 3rd class]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Alexander Nevsky]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Patriotic War, 1st class]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Myachin, Vasily}} [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Red Star]] [[Category:People from Oryol Governorate]] [[Category:Communist Party of the Soviet Union members]] [[Category:People from Terbunsky District]]
